title: Watch live: Atlas 5 rocket set to roll to launch pad today at Cape Canaveral
summary: United Launch Alliance plans to haul an Atlas 5 rocket to its launch pad Monday at Cape Canaveral on the eve of a planned blastoff with two commercial television broadcasting satellites for SES, owner of one of the largest fleets of geostationary communications spacecraft. The Atlas 5 rocket is set to roll out from the Vertical Integration Facility around 10 a.m. EDT (1400 GMT) Tuesday to begin the hour-long journey to pad 41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station.

title: With orbital launch, Firefly takes an early lead in the 1-ton rocket race
summary: "Firefly is at the point where the only thing holding them back is execution."

title: Amid Starship milestones, Booster 7 set to return for pre-launch testing
summary: SpaceX’s Starship program continues to march through a fluid set of milestones, ranging from a new record number of Raptor engines firing simultaneously, to the anticipated presence of a vehicle on the Starship pad at Florida’s historic LC-39A by the second quarter of 2023.

title: NASA pushes back Artemis 1 launch to November
summary: NASA will wait until at least the middle of November before attempting another launch of the Space Launch System on the Artemis 1 mission, citing the impacts from Hurricane Ian.

title: Space Development Agency is now officially part of the Space Force
summary: The Space Development Agency was officially transferred to the U.S. Space Force, Oct. 1.

title: NASA rules out launch of Artemis 1 moon rocket before mid-November
summary: NASA said Friday that officials have ruled out launching the agency’s first giant Space Launch System moon rocket and Orion spacecraft before mid-November, following the rocket’s return to the hangar at Kennedy Space Center for safekeeping from Hurricane Ian.

title: Preps resume for SpaceX crew launch after Hurricane Ian
summary: The multinational crew scheduled to ride a SpaceX rocket into orbit Wednesday arrived at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center Saturday as ground teams rolled their Falcon 9 booster and Dragon Endurance spacecraft to the launch pad, resuming work suspended earlier in the week as Hurricane Ian moved across Florida.

title: Firefly reaches orbit in successful demonstration launch from California
summary: Firefly Aerospace said its privately-developed Alpha small satellite launcher achieved “100% mission success” on a test flight from California early Saturday, adding another provider to the growing roster of commercial companies that have successfully fired a rocket into orbit.

title: Firefly, Millennium Space selected for U.S. Space Force rapid-launch demonstration
summary: The U.S. Space Systems Command announced Sept. 30 it selected Firefly Space Transport Services and Millennium Space Systems to conduct a demonstration of a rapid-response space mission to low Earth orbit in 2023.

title: Firefly’s Alpha rocket reaches orbit on second launch
summary: Firefly Aerospace’s Alpha launch vehicle reached orbit on its second launch Oct. 1, more than a year after the vehicle’s first launch failed.
